Package.Name: Replay FreeCamera
Package.Description:
activate in replay with 'F3'

Hotkeys for different manipulations with the camera:
bind to vehicle: B
show gun marker: N
show markers: H
set default roll: R
switch inertia: P
switch land camera: L
switch rotate around point: C
set default Fov: F

Package.Name: Zoom Out Config (meters)
Package.Description: How far you can zoom out in arcade mode in meters\nincrease scroll speed - your mouse wheel will be faster to scroll\ndisable gun shake - your aim will not shake when you are hit

Package.Name: Increase Scroll Speed
Package.Description: your mouse wheel will be faster to scroll

Package.Name: Server-side Reticle
Package.Description: Shows where the server thinks you are aiming. Server crosshair must be enabled in game settings.

Package.Name: Server Reticle by Awfultanker
Package.Description: Shows where the server thinks you are aiming. Server crosshair must be enabled in game settings.

Package.Name: Elkano´s Server Gun Marker (ElkSGM) (NOT Compatible with PMOD)
Package.Description: Shows where the server thinks you are aiming. Server crosshair must be enabled in game settings.

Package.Name: Battle Interface modifications - Server Reticle (pmod)
Package.Description: Shows where the server thinks you are aiming. Server crosshair must be enabled in game settings.

Package.Name: Penetration ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) Indicators
Package.Description: Shows wether or not you can penetrate an enemy, in the form of showing the number

Package.Name: PMOD Penetration ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) Indicator
Package.Description: Shows wether or not you can penetrate an enemy, factoring in armor angles and normalization, in the form\n avg_gun_penetration/enemy_effective_armor

Package.Name: Number Indicator of Armor Penetration ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) by Makct (non-PMOD)
Package.Description: Shows a number of chance of penetration. The number is calculated by (enemy_effective_armor-gun_average_penetration).\nNegative number means likely to bounce.\nPositive number means likely to pierce.

Package.Name: Zoom modifications - zoom in (pmod)
Package.Description: Allows you to change the ammount that you can zoom in.\nDefault zoom changes the first zoom in when you go to sniper mode\ntd brake allows you to change wether the tank moves when you point your gun out of gun range

Package.Name: Disable sniper scope shadow/green effect (PMOD)
Package.Description: Removes the shadow and green effect from the scope

Package.Name: Projectile Flytime for SPG/Arty by oldskool
Package.Description: This mod allows you to see the shell travel time for SPG shells. You can fully adjust the position of the display during the battle. Configuration of the mod can be done ingame.

Package.Name: Arty Splash Sphere by Spoter
Package.Description:
this will draw a sphere marking the stun area

Legal Info from WG employe Dance210:
Hey Silvers_,

We are currently working on the creation of a process that will more formally vet mods.

In the meantime, I do not personally feel that the mod you are asking about specifically violates the guidelines listed in the fair play policy. That said, those could change in the future and we do not recommend the use of any third-party mods, especially ones that may eventually be determined to provide an unfair information advantage.

Package.Name: Server Turret Extended by Spoter v{version}
Package.Description: -auto-speed for wheeled vehicles, \n-turns the tank turret along server coordinates, \n-automatically activates “Stop for a shot” when the tank is braked.

Package.Name: Battle Assistant v{version}
Package.Description: Enables an isometric view from Arty.\n\nTO USE THIS MOD YOU MUST ACTIVATE (PURCHASE OR AD SUPPORTED) HERE: http://armorinspector.com/en/battleassistant

Package.Name: Increased Smooth Time (0,5)
Package.Description: smoothes the mouse movement

Package.Name: Increased Zoom Speed
Package.Description: patch-file

Package.Name: Autoaim indication (press Right-ALT to en-/disable)
Package.Description:
Allows you to auto aim onto a visable target (red outline) when you right click.

Locks onto a target when manually highlighted, so it is legal now.

To enable or disable this mod, press the Right-ALT key.

Package.Name: 2 sec autoaim search
Package.Description: Search allows the player to right click and for 2 seconds it will snap on the first highlighted enemy.

Package.Name: 5 sec autoaim search
Package.Description: Search allows the player to right click and for 5 seconds it will snap on the first highlighted enemy.

Package.Name: infinite autoaim search
Package.Description: Search allows the player to right click, it will snap on the first highlighted enemy.

Package.Name: Autoaim Indicator Extended v{version}
Package.Description:
Using auto-aiming is very useful, especially when you start someone to twist or just the target stands and does not move. Grabbing it you no longer need to drive with your mouse and try to aim your gun at it. The majority of tankmen learned about this miracle of the invention after the introduction of the regime of tank racing. 

Often, in serious mixes, taking someone on an auto-target, you can forget whom you are keeping on the fly and this often does not have a very good effect on your effectiveness, because you can not shoot where you want to. In order to always be aware of what kind of goal is captured in your sight, there is a Mod: Indicator - an extended indication of this Mod. With his help, not to see the captured goal will be simply impossible.

By setting the mode of the extended auto-target display, you will see the following alerts on the captured target:
- on the captured tank will be included a constant stroke of the contour
- around will appear a semitransparent energy field
- if the target you capture suddenly leaves your field of vision, the arrow on the right or left will show directions and distance to it

The color of the energy field indicator changes in the mod settings in the hangar. Available colors are shown in the row below. 

Color options:
- blue
- brown
- chocolate
- cornflower blue
- cream
- blue cyan
- emerald
- golden
- green
- yellow-green
- hot pink
- lime
- orange
- pink
- purple
- red
- WG Backlight
- WG enemy
- WG friendly
- WG platoon
- yellow

Package.Name: english
Package.Description:
Using auto-aiming is very useful, especially when you start someone to twist or just the target stands and does not move. Grabbing it you no longer need to drive with your mouse and try to aim your gun at it. The majority of tankmen learned about this miracle of the invention after the introduction of the regime of tank racing. 

Often, in serious mixes, taking someone on an auto-target, you can forget whom you are keeping on the fly and this often does not have a very good effect on your effectiveness, because you can not shoot where you want to. In order to always be aware of what kind of goal is captured in your sight, there is a Mod: Indicator - an extended indication of this Mod. Package.Name: SafeShot Mods
Package.Description:
prevents you from shooting your gun to hit allies/dead tanks/etc.


legal info
http://forum.worldoftanks.eu/index.php?/topic/599621-wg-support-safeshot-is-illegal/page__st__20__pid__13403197#entry13403197

Package.Name: SafeShot by OldSkool
Package.Description: SafeShot is preventing team damage to allied tanks. This mod offers you a nice interface and the option to configure it ingame.

Package.Name: SafeShot by PROTanki
Package.UpdateComment: 2018-10-23: protanki made a spelling mistake (saveshot instead of safeshot), that caused errors loading correct config -> renamed/fixed!
Package.Description: The SafeShot mod is the disabling of accidental firing on corpses and allies for World of Tanks 1.0.1.1. A very useful mod that will save you from firing on already killed tanks. Example, you shoot the enemy is not one and finish it off, but you already poke without stopping the button and shoot into the already killed tank and leave not the CD. With this mod, this will not happen again. Also, the mod will help protect your account from your children or those who do not know people who can start shooting at their allies.

Package.Name: MeltyElement EffectiveArmorPanel (by elementofprgress)
Package.Description:
The effective armor calculator does, well exactly what it sounds like it does. 
It gives you real time information about the actual thickness of your hulls armor based on angle of your tank compared to where you are looking/aiming.
It also displays gun constraints.

It´s a remake of the ArmorPanel (& Protractor) that was included in the original MeltyMap sights. 
This mod shows front and side armor in current line of view (side armor without trucks).
(as i got asked: you DO NOT see the lines on the picture)

Attention! 
This mod was released by its developer as ALPHA!

Known Bugs:
When changing the volume level with windows-shortcuts or over the keyboard (if your keyboard got this) there will be a light red ball appearing on the screen. this is meant for debugging the mod by the developers and currently can´t get disabled!

Package.Name: BalCalcMod
Package.Description: The mod is designed to remedy the situation where it is impossible to aim above the hill. (Overshooting)
